017package org.microbean.loader.api;
018
019import java.lang.reflect.ParameterizedType;
020import java.lang.reflect.Type;
021import java.lang.reflect.TypeVariable;
022
023import java.util.List;
024import java.util.Objects;
025import java.util.ServiceLoader;
026
027import org.microbean.development.annotation.EntryPoint;
028import org.microbean.development.annotation.Experimental;
029import org.microbean.development.annotation.OverridingDiscouraged;
030
031import org.microbean.invoke.OptionalSupplier;
032
033import org.microbean.path.Path;
034import org.microbean.path.Path.Element;
035
036import org.microbean.qualifier.Qualifiers;
037
038import org.microbean.type.JavaType.Token;
039
040/**
041 * An {@link OptionalSupplier} that {@linkplain #get() supplies} an
042 * environmental object, and can {@linkplain #load(Path) load} others.
043 *
044 * <p><strong>Note:</strong> {@link Loader} implementations are
045 * expected to be immutable with respect to the methods exposed by
046 * this interface.  All methods in this interface that have a {@link
047 * Loader}-typed return type require their implementations to return a
048 * <em>new</em> {@link Loader}.</p>
049 *
050 * <p>The presence of the {@link
051 * OverridingDiscouraged @OverridingDiscouraged} annotation on a
052 * method means that undefined behavior may result if an
053 * implementation of this interface provides an alternate
054 * implementation of the method in question.</p>
055 *
056 * @param <T> the type of environmental objects this {@link Loader}
057 * {@linkplain #get() supplies}
058 *
059 * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson"
060 * target="_parent">Laird Nelson</a>
061 *
062 * @see #loader()
063 *
064 * @see OptionalSupplier#get()
065 *
066 * @see #load(Path)
067 */
068public interface Loader<T> extends OptionalSupplier<T> {
069
070  /**
071   * Returns the {@link Loader} that is the parent of this {@link
072   * Loader}.
073   *
074   * <p>The {@linkplain #root() root <code>Loader</code>} is defined
075   * to be the only one whose {@link #parent()} method returns itself.
076   * It follows that in general a {@link Loader} implementation should
077   * not return {@code this}.  See {@link #isRoot()} for details.</p>
078   *
079   * @return the {@link Loader} that is the parent of this {@link
080   * Loader}; not {@code this} in almost all circumstances
081   *
082   * @nullability Implementations of this method must not return
083   * {@code null}.
084   *
085   * @idempotency Implementations of this method must be idempotent
086   * and deterministic.
087   *
088   * @threadsafety Implementations of this method must be safe for
089   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
090   *
091   * @see #root()
092   *
093   * @see #isRoot()
094   *
095   * @see #loader()
096   */
097  public Loader<?> parent();
098
099  /**
100   * Returns the {@link Path} with which this {@link Loader} was
101   * created.
102   *
103   * <p>The {@link Path} that is returned by an implementation of this
104   * method is not guaranteed to be {@linkplain Path#absolute()
105   * absolute}.</p>
106   *
107   * <p>The {@link Path} that is returned by an implementation of this
108   * method must be {@linkplain Path#equals(Object) equal} to a
109   * {@linkplain #transliterate(Path) transliterated} version of the
110   * {@link Path} that was supplied to the {@link #load(Path)} method
111   * of this {@link Loader}'s {@linkplain #parent() parent} that
112   * resulted in this {@link Loader}'s creation.</p>
113   *
114   * @return the non-{@code null} {@link Path} with which this {@link
115   * Loader} was created
116   *
117   * @nullability Implementations of this method must not return
118   * {@code null}.
119   *
120   * @threadsafety Implementations of this method must be safe for
121   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
122   *
123   * @idempotency Implementations of this method must be idempotent
124   * and deterministic.
125   *
126   * @see #parent()
127   *
128   * @see #load(Path)
129   *
130   * @see #absolutePath()
131   *
132   * @see #absolutePath(Path)
133   */
134  public Path<? extends Type> path(); // must be absolute
135
136  /**
137   * Experimental; do not use.
138   *
139   * @return an {@linkplain Path#absolute() absolute
140   * <code>Path</code>}
141   *
142   * @exception NullPointerException if {@link #path()} or {@link
143   * #parent()} is implemented incorrectly
144   *
145   * @nullability This method does not, and its overrides must not,
146   * return {@code null}.
147   *
148   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
149   * idempotent and deterministic.
150   *
151   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
152   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
153   *
154   * @see #absolutePath(Path)
155   */
156  @Experimental
157  public default Path<? extends Type> absolutePath() {
158    return this.absolutePath(this.path());
159  }
160
161  /**
162   * Returns an {@linkplain Path#absolute() absolute} {@link Path} representing the
163   *
164   * @param <P> the type of the path
165   *
166   * @param path a {@link Path}; must not be {@code null}
167   *
168   * @return an {@linkplain Path#absolute() absolute
169   * <code>Path</code>}
170   *
171   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code path} is {@code null}
172   * or if #parent()} is implemented incorrectly
173   *
174   * @nullability This method does not, and its (discouraged)
175   * overrides must not, return {@code null}.
176   *
177   * @idempotency This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides must
178   * be, idempotent and deterministic.
179   *
180   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides
181   * must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
182   */
183  @Experimental
184  @OverridingDiscouraged
185  public default <P> Path<P> absolutePath(final Path<P> path) {
186    return path.absolute() ? path : this.parent().absolutePath().plus(path);
187  }
188
189  /**
190   * Uses the addressing information encoded in the supplied {@link
191   * Path} to load and return the {@link Loader} logically found at
192   * that location, following additional contractual requirements
193   * defined below.
194   *
195   * <p>Any {@link Loader} returned by an implementation of this
196   * method:</p>
197   *
198   * <ul>
199   *
200   * <li>must not be {@code null}</li>
201   *
202   * <li>must implement its {@link #get() get()} method and its {@link
203   * #determinism() determinism()} method to indicate the transitory
204   * or permanent presence or absence of any value it might
205   * {@linkplain #get() supply}</li>
206   *
207   * </ul>
208   *
209   * <p>The default implementations of all other methods in this
210   * interface named {@code load} call this method.</p>
211   *
212   * @param <U> the type of the environmental object the returned
213   * {@link Loader} can {@linkplain #get() supply}
214   *
215   * @param path the {@link Path} (perhaps only partially) identifying
216   * the {@link Loader} to load; must not be {@code null}; may be
217   * {@linkplain Path#absolute() absolute} or relative (in which case
218   * it will be {@linkplain Path#plus(Path) appended} to {@linkplain
219   * #path() this <code>Loader</code>'s <code>Path</code>})
220   *
221   * @return a {@link Loader} for the supplied {@link Path}; must not
222   * be {@code null}, but may implement its {@link #get() get()}
223   * method and its {@link #determinism() determinism()} method to
224   * indicate the transitory or permanent presence or absence of any
225   * value it might {@linkplain #get() supply}
226   *
227   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code path} is {@code null}
228   *
229   * @exception ClassCastException if the implementation is
230   * implemented improperly
231   *
232   * @see #get()
233   *
234   * @see #determinism()
235   */
236  @EntryPoint
237  public <U> Loader<U> load(final Path<? extends Type> path);
238
239  /**
240   * Builds a {@link Path} from the supplied arguments, calls the
241   * {@link #load(Path)} method and returns its result.
242   *
243   * @param <U> the type of environmental objects the returned {@link Loader}
244   * {@linkplain #get() will supply}
245   *
246   * @param qualifiers the path's {@link Qualifiers}; must not be
247   * {@code null}
248   *
249   * @param type the path's {@link Type}; must not be {@code null}
250   *
251   * @return a {@link Loader}
252   *
253   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
254   *
255   * @nullability This method does not, and its (discouraged)
256   * overrides must not, return {@code null}.
257   *
258   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
259   * determinism with respect to this method or its (discouraged)
260   * overrides.
261   *
262   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides
263   * must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
264   *
265   * @see Path#of(Qualifiers, Element)
266   *
267   * @see Element#of(Object, String)
268   *
269   * @see #load(Path)
270   */
271  @OverridingDiscouraged
272  @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
273  public default <U> Loader<U> load(final Qualifiers<? extends String, ?> qualifiers, final Type type) {
274    if (type instanceof Class<?> c) {
275      return this.load(qualifiers, (Class<U>)c);
276    }
277    return this.load(Path.of(qualifiers, Element.of(type, "")));
278  }
279
280  /**
281   * Builds a {@link Path} from the supplied arguments, calls the
282   * {@link #load(Path)} method and returns its result.
283   *
284   * @param <U> the type of environmental objects the returned {@link Loader}
285   * {@linkplain #get() will supply}
286   *
287   * @param type the path's {@link Type}; must not be {@code null}
288   *
289   * @return a {@link Loader}
290   *
291   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
292   *
293   * @nullability This method does not, and its (discouraged)
294   * overrides must not, return {@code null}.
295   *
296   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
297   * determinism with respect to this method or its (discouraged)
298   * overrides.
299   *
300   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides
301   * must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
302   *
303   * @see Path#of(Object)
304   *
305   * @see #load(Path)
306   */
307  @OverridingDiscouraged
308  @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
309  public default <U> Loader<U> load(final Type type) {
310    if (type instanceof Class<?> c) {
311      return this.load((Class<U>)c);
312    }
313    return this.load(Path.of(type));
314  }
315
316  /**
317   * Builds a {@link Path} from the supplied arguments, calls the
318   * {@link #load(Path)} method and returns its result.
319   *
320   * @param <U> the type of environmental objects the returned {@link Loader}
321   * {@linkplain #get() will supply}
322   *
323   * @param type the path's {@link Type}; must not be {@code null}
324   *
325   * @param name the {@linkplain Element#name() name} of the last
326   * {@link Element} in the {@link Path}; must not be {@code null}
327   *
328   * @return a {@link Loader}
329   *
330   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
331   *
332   * @nullability This method does not, and its (discouraged)
333   * overrides must not, return {@code null}.
334   *
335   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
336   * determinism with respect to this method or its (discouraged)
337   * overrides.
338   *
339   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides
340   * must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
341   *
342   * @see #load(Path)
343   */
344  @OverridingDiscouraged
345  @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
346  public default <U> Loader<U> load(final Type type, final String name) {
347    if (type instanceof Class<?> c) {
348      return this.load((Class<U>)c, name);
349    }
350    return this.load(Path.of(type, name));
351  }
352
353  /**
354   * Builds a {@link Path} from the supplied arguments, calls the
355   * {@link #load(Path)} method and returns its result.
356   *
357   * @param <U> the type of environmental objects the returned {@link Loader}
358   * {@linkplain #get() will supply}
359   *
360   * @param type the path's {@link Type}; must not be {@code null}
361   *
362   * @param names the sequence of names forming the {@link Path}; must
363   * not be {@code null}
364   *
365   * @return a {@link Loader}
366   *
367   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
368   *
369   * @nullability This method does not, and its (discouraged)
370   * overrides must not, return {@code null}.
371   *
372   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
373   * determinism with respect to this method or its (discouraged)
374   * overrides.
375   *
376   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides
377   * must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
378   *
379   * @see #load(Path)
380   */
381  @OverridingDiscouraged
382  @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
383  public default <U> Loader<U> load(final Type type, final String... names) {
384    if (type instanceof Class<?> c) {
385      return this.load((Class<U>)c, names);
386    }
387    return this.load(Path.of(type, names));
388  }
389
390  /**
391   * Builds a {@link Path} from the supplied arguments, calls the
392   * {@link #load(Path)} method and returns its result.
393   *
394   * @param <U> the type of environmental objects the returned {@link Loader}
395   * {@linkplain #get() will supply}
396   *
397   * @param type the path's {@link Type}; must not be {@code null}
398   *
399   * @param names the sequence of names forming the {@link Path}; must
400   * not be {@code null}
401   *
402   * @return a {@link Loader}
403   *
404   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
405   *
406   * @nullability This method does not, and its (discouraged)
407   * overrides must not, return {@code null}.
408   *
409   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
410   * determinism with respect to this method or its (discouraged)
411   * overrides.
412   *
413   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides
414   * must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
415   *
416   * @see #load(Path)
417   */
418  @OverridingDiscouraged
419  @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
420  public default <U> Loader<U> load(final Type type, final List<? extends String> names) {
421    if (type instanceof Class<?> c) {
422      return this.load((Class<U>)c, names);
423    }
424    return this.load(Path.of(type, names));
425  }
426
427  /**
428   * Builds a {@link Path} from the supplied arguments, calls the
429   * {@link #load(Path)} method and returns its result.
430   *
431   * @param <U> the type of environmental objects the returned {@link Loader}
432   * {@linkplain #get() will supply}
433   *
434   * @param qualifiers the path's {@link Qualifiers}; must not be
435   * {@code null}
436   *
437   * @param type a {@link Token} representing the path's {@link Type};
438   * must not be {@code null}
439   *
440   * @return a {@link Loader}
441   *
442   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
443   *
444   * @nullability This method does not, and its (discouraged)
445   * overrides must not, return {@code null}.
446   *
447   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
448   * determinism with respect to this method or its (discouraged)
449   * overrides.
450   *
451   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides
452   * must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
453   *
454   * @see #load(Path)
455   */
456  @OverridingDiscouraged
457  public default <U> Loader<U> load(final Qualifiers<? extends String, ?> qualifiers, final Token<U> type) {
458    return this.load(qualifiers, type.type());
459  }
460
461  /**
462   * Builds a {@link Path} from the supplied arguments, calls the
463   * {@link #load(Path)} method and returns its result.
464   *
465   * @param <U> the type of environmental objects the returned {@link Loader}
466   * {@linkplain #get() will supply}
467   *
468   * @param type a {@link Token} representing the path's {@link Type};
469   * must not be {@code null}
470   *
471   * @return a {@link Loader}
472   *
473   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
474   *
475   * @nullability This method does not, and its (discouraged)
476   * overrides must not, return {@code null}.
477   *
478   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
479   * determinism with respect to this method or its (discouraged)
480   * overrides.
481   *
482   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides
483   * must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
484   *
485   * @see #load(Path)
486   */
487  @OverridingDiscouraged
488  public default <U> Loader<U> load(final Token<U> type) {
489    return this.load(type.type());
490  }
491
492  /**
493   * Builds a {@link Path} from the supplied arguments, calls the
494   * {@link #load(Path)} method and returns its result.
495   *
496   * @param <U> the type of environmental objects the returned {@link Loader}
497   * {@linkplain #get() will supply}
498   *
499   * @param type a {@link Token} representing the path's {@link Type};
500   * must not be {@code null}
501   *
502   * @param name the {@linkplain Element#name() name} of the last
503   * {@link Element} in the {@link Path}; must not be {@code null}
504   *
505   * @return a {@link Loader}
506   *
507   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
508   *
509   * @nullability This method does not, and its (discouraged)
510   * overrides must not, return {@code null}.
511   *
512   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
513   * determinism with respect to this method or its (discouraged)
514   * overrides.
515   *
516   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides
517   * must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
518   *
519   * @see #load(Path)
520   */
521  @OverridingDiscouraged
522  public default <U> Loader<U> load(final Token<U> type, final String name) {
523    return this.load(type.type(), name);
524  }
525
526  /**
527   * Builds a {@link Path} from the supplied arguments, calls the
528   * {@link #load(Path)} method and returns its result.
529   *
530   * @param <U> the type of environmental objects the returned {@link Loader}
531   * {@linkplain #get() will supply}
532   *
533   * @param type a {@link Token} representing the path's {@link Type};
534   * must not be {@code null}
535   *
536   * @param names the sequence of names forming the {@link Path}; must
537   * not be {@code null}
538   *
539   * @return a {@link Loader}
540   *
541   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
542   *
543   * @nullability This method does not, and its (discouraged)
544   * overrides must not, return {@code null}.
545   *
546   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
547   * determinism with respect to this method or its (discouraged)
548   * overrides.
549   *
550   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides
551   * must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
552   *
553   * @see #load(Path)
554   */
555  @OverridingDiscouraged
556  public default <U> Loader<U> load(final Token<U> type, final String... names) {
557    return this.load(type.type(), names);
558  }
559
560  /**
561   * Builds a {@link Path} from the supplied arguments, calls the
562   * {@link #load(Path)} method and returns its result.
563   *
564   * @param <U> the type of environmental objects the returned {@link Loader}
565   * {@linkplain #get() will supply}
566   *
567   * @param type a {@link Token} representing the path's {@link Type};
568   * must not be {@code null}
569   *
570   * @param names the sequence of names forming the {@link Path}; must
571   * not be {@code null}
572   *
573   * @return a {@link Loader}
574   *
575   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
576   *
577   * @nullability This method does not, and its (discouraged)
578   * overrides must not, return {@code null}.
579   *
580   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
581   * determinism with respect to this method or its (discouraged)
582   * overrides.
583   *
584   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides
585   * must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
586   *
587   * @see #load(Path)
588   */
589  @OverridingDiscouraged
590  public default <U> Loader<U> load(final Token<U> type, final List<? extends String> names) {
591    return this.load(type.type(), names);
592  }
593
594  /**
595   * Builds a {@link Path} from the supplied arguments, calls the
596   * {@link #load(Path)} method and returns its result.
597   *
598   * @param <U> the type of environmental objects the returned {@link Loader}
599   * {@linkplain #get() will supply}
600   *
601   * @param qualifiers the path's {@link Qualifiers}; must not be
602   * {@code null}
603   *
604   * @param type a {@link Class} serving as the path's {@link Type};
605   * must not be {@code null}
606   *
607   * @return a {@link Loader}
608   *
609   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
610   *
611   * @nullability This method does not, and its (discouraged)
612   * overrides must not, return {@code null}.
613   *
614   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
615   * determinism with respect to this method or its (discouraged)
616   * overrides.
617   *
618   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides
619   * must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
620   *
621   * @see #load(Path)
622   */
623  @OverridingDiscouraged
624  public default <U> Loader<U> load(final Qualifiers<? extends String, ?> qualifiers, Class<U> type) {
625    return this.load(Path.of(qualifiers, Element.of(type, "")));
626  }
627
628  /**
629   * Builds a {@link Path} from the supplied arguments, calls the
630   * {@link #load(Path)} method and returns its result.
631   *
632   * @param <U> the type of environmental objects the returned {@link Loader}
633   * {@linkplain #get() will supply}
634   *
635   * @param type a {@link Class} serving as the path's {@link Type};
636   * must not be {@code null}
637   *
638   * @return a {@link Loader}
639   *
640   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
641   *
642   * @nullability This method does not, and its (discouraged)
643   * overrides must not, return {@code null}.
644   *
645   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
646   * determinism with respect to this method or its (discouraged)
647   * overrides.
648   *
649   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides
650   * must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
651   *
652   * @see #load(Path)
653   */
654  @OverridingDiscouraged
655  public default <U> Loader<U> load(final Class<U> type) {
656    return this.load(Path.of(type));
657  }
658
659  /**
660   * Builds a {@link Path} from the supplied arguments, calls the
661   * {@link #load(Path)} method and returns its result.
662   *
663   * @param <U> the type of environmental objects the returned {@link Loader}
664   * {@linkplain #get() will supply}
665   *
666   * @param type a {@link Class} serving as the path's {@link Type};
667   * must not be {@code null}
668   *
669   * @param name the {@linkplain Element#name() name} of the last
670   * {@link Element} in the {@link Path}; must not be {@code null}
671   *
672   * @return a {@link Loader}
673   *
674   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
675   *
676   * @nullability This method does not, and its (discouraged)
677   * overrides must not, return {@code null}.
678   *
679   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
680   * determinism with respect to this method or its (discouraged)
681   * overrides.
682   *
683   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides
684   * must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
685   *
686   * @see #load(Path)
687   */
688  @OverridingDiscouraged
689  public default <U> Loader<U> load(final Class<U> type, final String name) {
690    return this.load(Path.of(type, name));
691  }
692
693  /**
694   * Builds a {@link Path} from the supplied arguments, calls the
695   * {@link #load(Path)} method and returns its result.
696   *
697   * @param <U> the type of environmental objects the returned {@link Loader}
698   * {@linkplain #get() will supply}
699   *
700   * @param type a {@link Class} serving as the path's {@link Type};
701   * must not be {@code null}
702   *
703   * @param names the sequence of names forming the {@link Path}; must
704   * not be {@code null}
705   *
706   * @return a {@link Loader}
707   *
708   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
709   *
710   * @nullability This method does not, and its (discouraged)
711   * overrides must not, return {@code null}.
712   *
713   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
714   * determinism with respect to this method or its (discouraged)
715   * overrides.
716   *
717   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides
718   * must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
719   *
720   * @see #load(Path)
721   */
722  @OverridingDiscouraged
723  public default <U> Loader<U> load(final Class<U> type, final String... names) {
724    return this.load(Path.of(type, names));
725  }
726
727  /**
728   * Builds a {@link Path} from the supplied arguments, calls the
729   * {@link #load(Path)} method and returns its result.
730   *
731   * @param <U> the type of environmental objects the returned {@link Loader}
732   * {@linkplain #get() will supply}
733   *
734   * @param type a {@link Class} serving as the path's {@link Type};
735   * must not be {@code null}
736   *
737   * @param names the sequence of names forming the {@link Path}; must
738   * not be {@code null}
739   *
740   * @return a {@link Loader}
741   *
742   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
743   *
744   * @nullability This method does not, and its (discouraged)
745   * overrides must not, return {@code null}.
746   *
747   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
748   * determinism with respect to this method or its (discouraged)
749   * overrides.
750   *
751   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides
752   * must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
753   *
754   * @see #load(Path)
755   */
756  @OverridingDiscouraged
757  public default <U> Loader<U> load(final Class<U> type, final List<? extends String> names) {
758    return this.load(Path.of(type, names));
759  }
760
761  /**
762   * Returns an ancestral {@link Loader}, derived from and possibly
763   * identical to this {@link Loader}, that is suitable for a
764   * {@linkplain #transliterate(Path) transliterated} and {@linkplain
765   * Path#absolute() absolute} version of the supplied {@code path},
766   * particularly for cases where, during the execution of the {@link
767   * #load(Path)} method, a {@link Loader} must be supplied to some
768   * other class.
769   *
770   * <p>The returned {@link Loader} must be one whose {@link #path()}
771   * method returns the {@linkplain Path#size() longest} {@link Path}
772   * that is a parent of an {@linkplain Path#absolute() absolute}
773   * version of the ({@linkplain #transliterate(Path) transliterated})
774   * supplied {@code path}.  In many cases {@code this} will be
775   * returned.</p>
776   *
777   * <p>Typically only classes implementing this interface will need
778   * to call this method.  Most users will have no need to call this
779   * method directly.</p>
780   *
781   * <p>Overriding of this method is <strong>very strongly</strong>
782   * discouraged.</p>
783   *
784   * @param path the {@link Path} in question; must not be {@code
785   * null}
786   *
787   * @return an ancestral {@link Loader}, derived from and possibly
788   * identical to this {@link Loader}, that is suitable for a
789   * {@linkplain #transliterate(Path) transliterated} and {@linkplain
790   * Path#absolute() absolute} version of the supplied {@code path},
791   * particularly for cases where, during the execution of the {@link
792   * #load(Path)} method, a {@link Loader} must be supplied to some
793   * other class; never {@code null}
794   *
795   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code path} is {@code null}
796   *
797   * @nullability The default implementation of this method does not,
798   * and its (discouraged) overrides must not, return {@code null}.
799   *
800   * @threadsafety The default implementation of this method is, and
801   * its (discouraged) overrides must be, safe for concurrent use by
802   * multiple threads.
803   *
804   * @idempotency The default implementation of this method is, and
805   * its (discouraged) overrides must be, idempotent and
806   * deterministic.
807   *
808   * @see #transliterate(Path)
809   *
810   * @see #root()
811   */
812  @OverridingDiscouraged
813  public default Loader<?> loaderFor(Path<? extends Type> path) {
814    Objects.requireNonNull(path, "path");
815    final Loader<?> parent = this.parent();
816    if (this != parent) {
817      final Path<? extends Type> absolutePath = this.absolutePath();
818      assert absolutePath.absolute() : "!absolutePath.absolute(): " + absolutePath;
819      assert absolutePath.transliterated();
820      if (!path.absolute()) {
821        path = absolutePath.plus(path);
822        assert path.absolute();
823      }
824      path = this.transliterate(path);
825      // TODO: note that this does not take a Path's top-level
826      // qualifiers into account.  Maybe that's on purpose?
827      if (absolutePath.startsWith(path)) {
828        // This Loader's absolute path (e.g. /a/b/c/d) begins with
829        // path (e.g. /a/b or /a/b/c/d), and so could also equal its
830        // sequence of path elements (e.g. if path is also /a/b/c/d).
831        // We don't care about the equals case, only the
832        // starts-with-but-not-equal case.
833        final int absolutePathSize = absolutePath.size();
834        final int pathSize = path.size();
835        if (absolutePathSize > pathSize) {
836          // This Loader's absolute path(e.g. /a/b/c/d) begins with
837          // path (e.g. /a/b) and does not have the same sequence of
838          // path elements.
839          return parent.loaderFor(path); // NOTE: recursive call
840        }
841      } else {
842        return this.root();
843      }
844    }
845    return this;
846  }
847
848  /**
849   * <em>Transliterates</em> the supplied {@linkplain Path#absolute()
850   * absolute <code>Path</code>} into some other {@link Path}, whose
851   * meaning is the same, but whose representation may be different,
852   * that will be used instead.
853   *
854   * <p>The {@link Path} that is returned may be the {@link Path} that
855   * was supplied.  This may happen, for example, if {@linkplain
856   * Path#transliterated() the path has already been transliterated},
857   * or if the path identifies a transliteration request.</p>
858   *
859   * <p>Path transliteration is needed because the {@link
860   * Element#name() name()} components of {@link Element}s may
861   * unintentionally clash when two components are combined into a
862   * single application.</p>
863   *
864   * <p>Path transliteration must occur during the execution of any
865   * implementation of the {@link #load(Path)} method, such that the
866   * {@link Path} supplied to that method, once it has been verified
867   * to be {@linkplain Path#absolute() absolute}, is supplied to an
868   * implementation of this method. The {@link Path} returned by an
869   * implementation of this method must then be used during the rest
870   * of the invocation of the {@link #load(Path)} method, as if it had
871   * been supplied in the first place.</p>
872   *
873   * <p>Behavior resulting from any other usage of an implementation
874   * of this method is undefined.</p>
875   *
876   * <p>The default implementation of this method uses the
877   * configuration system itself to find a transliterated {@link Path}
878   * corresponding to the supplied {@link Path}, returning the
879   * supplied {@code path} itself if no transliteration can take
880   * place.  Infinite loops are avoided except as noted below.</p>
881   *
882   * <p>Overrides of this method <strong>must not call {@link
883   * #loaderFor(Path)}</strong> or an infinite loop may
884   * result.</p>
885   *
886   * <p>Overrides of this method <strong>must not call {@link
887   * #load(Path)} with the supplied {@code path}</strong> or an infinite
888   * loop may result.</p>
889   *
890   * <p>An implementation of {@link Loader} will find {@link
891   * Path#transliterate(java.util.function.BiFunction)} particularly
892   * useful in implementing this method.</p>
893   *
894   * <p>Most users will have no need to call this method directly.</p>
895   *
896   * @param <U> the type of the supplied and returned {@link Path}s
897   *
898   * @param path an {@linkplain Path#absolute() absolute
899   * <code>Path</code>}; must not be null
900   *
901   * @return the transliterated {@link Path}; never {@code null};
902   * possibly the supplied {@code path} itself
903   *
904   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code path} is {@code null}
905   *
906   * @exception IllegalArgumentException if {@code path} returns
907   * {@code false} from its {@link Path#absolute() absolute()}
908   * method
909   *
910   * @nullability The default implementation of this method does not,
911   * and its (discouraged) overrides must not, return {@code null}.
912   *
913   * @threadsafety The default implementation of this method is, and
914   * its (discouraged) overrides must be, safe for concurrent use by
915   * multiple threads.
916   *
917   * @idempotency The default implementation of this method is, and
918   * its (discouraged) overrides must be, idempotent and
919   * deterministic.
920   *
921   * @see Path#absolute()
922   *
923   * @see Path#transliterate(java.util.function.BiFunction)
924   *
925   * @see #loaderFor(Path)
926   *
927   * @see #load(Path)
928   */
929  @OverridingDiscouraged
930  public default <U extends Type> Path<U> transliterate(final Path<U> path) {
931    if (path.transliterated()) {
932      return path;
933    } else if (path.lastElement().name().equals("org.microbean.loader.api.transliteration") &&
934               path.lastElement().qualified() instanceof ParameterizedType ptype &&
935               ptype.getRawType() instanceof Class<?> c &&
936               Path.class.isAssignableFrom(c)) {
937      // (All of these tests are to check: is the supplied Path a
938      // transliteration request?)
939      //
940      // The last element's type should be a parameterized type
941      // representing Path<Something>.  The last element's qualifiers
942      // will also contain a "path" key with the original Path being
943      // transliterated, but we don't need to check that.
944      //
945      // In such a case: mark the transliteration request itself as
946      // already transliterated to kill off infinite loops.
947      return path.transliterate();
948    }
949    final ParameterizedType ptype = (ParameterizedType)new Token<Path<U>>() {}.type();
950    final Element<ParameterizedType> e = Element.of(Qualifiers.of("path", path), ptype, "org.microbean.loader.api.transliteration");
951    // Note that we transliterate the transliteration request itself
952    // with a no-op: this marks the request itself as already
953    // transliterated, which should kill off any infinite loops.
954    final Path<ParameterizedType> transliterationRequest = Path.root().plus(e).transliterate();
955    assert transliterationRequest.absolute();
956    Path<U> returnValue = this.<Path<U>>load(transliterationRequest).orElse(path);
957    if (returnValue == null) {
958      // null is not a permitted return value for this method,
959      // although it may be a valid value from a provider.  Treat it
960      // as absent by simply marking the supplied path as already
961      // transliterated.
962      returnValue = path.transliterate();
963    } else if (!returnValue.transliterated()) {
964      returnValue = returnValue.transliterate();
965    }
966    return returnValue;
967  }
968
969  /**
970   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Loader} is the
971   * root {@link Loader}, which occurs only when the return value of
972   * {@link #parent() this.parent() == this}.
973   *
974   * <p>Overrides of this method are <strong>strongly</strong>
975   * discouraged.</p>
976   *
977   * <p>Most users will have no need to call this method directly.</p>
978   *
979   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Loader} is the
980   * root {@link Loader}
981   *
982   * @idempotency This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides must
983   * be, idempotent and deterministic.
984   *
985   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides
986   * must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
987   *
988   * @see #parent()
989   */
990  @OverridingDiscouraged
991  public default boolean isRoot() {
992    return this.parent() == this;
993  }
994
995  /**
996   * Returns the root {@link Loader}, which is the {@link Loader}
997   * whose {@link #parent()} method returns iteself.
998   *
999   * <p>Overrides of this method are <strong>strongly</strong>
1000   * discouraged.</p>
1001   *
1002   * <p>Most users will have no need to call this method directly.</p>
1003   *
1004   * @return the root {@link Loader}
1005   *
1006   * @nullability This method does not, and its (discouraged)
1007   * overrides must not, return {@code null}.
1008   *
1009   * @idempotency This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides must
1010   * be, idempotent and deterministic.
1011   *
1012   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides
1013   * must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
1014   *
1015   * @see #isRoot()
1016   *
1017   * @see #parent()
1018   *
1019   * @see Path#root()
1020   */
1021  @OverridingDiscouraged
1022  public default Loader<?> root() {
1023    Loader<?> root = this;
1024    Loader<?> parent = root.parent();
1025    while (parent != null && parent != root) {
1026      // (Strictly speaking, Loader::parent should NEVER be null.)
1027      root = parent;
1028      parent = root.parent();
1029    }
1030    assert root.path().isRoot();
1031    assert root.parent() == root;
1032    assert this == root ? true : !this.path().isRoot();
1033    return root;
1034  }
1035
1036  /**
1037   * Casts this {@link Loader} appropriately and returns it, usually
1038   * so that an implementation's implementation-specific methods can
1039   * be accessed.
1040   *
1041   * @param <L> the {@link Loader} subclass
1042   *
1043   * @param loaderSubclass a {@link Class} representing a subclass of
1044   * {@link Loader}; must not be {@code null}
1045   *
1046   * @return this {@link Loader}
1047   *
1048   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code loaderSubclass} is
1049   * {@code null}
1050   *
1051   * @exception ClassCastException if the cast could not be performed
1052   *
1053   * @nullability This method does not, and its (discouraged)
1054   * overrides must not, return {@code null}.
1055   *
1056   * @idempotency This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides must
1057   * be, idempotent and deterministic.
1058   *
1059   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides
1060   * must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
1061   */
1062  @OverridingDiscouraged
1063  public default <L extends Loader<?>> L as(final Class<L> loaderSubclass) {
1064    return loaderSubclass.cast(this);
1065  }
1066
1067  /**
1068   * Bootstraps and returns a {@link Loader}.
1069   *
1070   * <p>If this method has been called before, its prior result is
1071   * returned.</p>
1072   *
1073   * <p>Otherwise, first, the <em>root {@link Loader}</em> is located
1074   * using Java's built-in {@link ServiceLoader}.  The first of the
1075   * {@link Loader} instances it discovers is used and all others are
1076   * ignored.  Note that the {@link ServiceLoader} discovery process
1077   * is non-deterministic.  Normally there is only one such {@link
1078   * Loader} provided by an implementation of this API.</p>
1079   *
1080   * <p>The root {@link Loader} that is loaded via this mechanism is
1081   * subject to the following restrictions:</p>
1082   *
1083   * <ul>
1084   *
1085   * <li>It must return a {@link Path} from its {@link #path()}
1086   * implementation that is {@linkplain Path#equals(Object) equal to}
1087   * {@link Path#root() Path.root()}.</li>
1088   *
1089   * <li>It must return a {@link Path} from its {@link
1090   * #absolutePath()} implementation that is {@linkplain
1091   * Path#equals(Object) equal to} {@link Path#root()
1092   * Path.root()}.</li>
1093   *
1094   * <li>It must return itself ({@code this}) from its {@link
1095   * #parent()} implementation.</li>
1096   *
1097   * <li>It must return {@code true} from its {@link #isRoot()}
1098   * implementation.</li>
1099   *
1100   * <li>It must return itself ({@code this}) from its {@link #root()}
1101   * method.</li>
1102   *
1103   * <li>It must return {@link Determinism#PRESENT} from its {@link
1104   * #determinism() determinism()} method.</li>
1105   *
1106   * <li>It must return itself ({@code this}) from its {@link #get()
1107   * get()} method.</li>
1108   *
1109   * </ul>
1110   *
1111   * <p>Next, this root {@link Loader} is used to {@linkplain
1112   * #load(Path) find} the <em>{@link Loader} of record</em>, which in
1113   * most cases is simply itself.</p>
1114   *
1115   * <p>The {@link Loader} of record is subject to the following
1116   * restrictions (which are compatible with the overwhelmingly common
1117   * case of its also being the root {@link Loader}):</p>
1118   *
1119   * <ul>
1120   *
1121   * <li>It must return a {@link Path} from its {@link #path()}
1122   * implementation that is equal to {@link Path#root() Path.root()}
1123   * (same as above).</li>
1124   *
1125   * <li>It must return a {@link Path} from its {@link
1126   * #absolutePath()} implementation that is equal to {@link
1127   * Path#root() Path.root()} (same as above).</li>
1128   *
1129   * <li>It must return {@link Determinism#PRESENT} from its {@link
1130   * #determinism() determinism()} method (same as above).</li>
1131   *
1132   * <li>It must return the root {@link Loader} from its {@link
1133   * #parent()} implementation (which may be itself ({@code
1134   * this})).</li>
1135   *
1136   * <li>It must return a {@link Loader} implementation, often itself
1137   * ({@code this}), from its {@link #get() get()} method.</li>
1138   *
1139   * </ul>
1140   *
1141   * <p>An {@link IllegalStateException} will be thrown if an
1142   * implementation of the {@link Loader} interface does not honor the
1143   * requirements above.</p>
1144   *
1145   * <p>This method is the primary entry point for end users of this
1146   * framework.</p>
1147   *
1148   * @return a non-{@code null} {@link Loader} that can be used to
1149   * acquire environmental objects that abides by the requirements and
1150   * restrictions above
1151   *
1152   * @exception IllegalStateException if any of the requirements and
1153   * restrictions above is violated
1154   *
1155   * @exception java.util.ServiceConfigurationError if the root {@link
1156   * Loader} could not be loaded for any reason
1157   *
1158   * @exception NoClassDefFoundError if the root {@link Loader} could
1159   * not be loaded for any reason
1160   */
1161  @EntryPoint
1162  public static Loader<?> loader() {
1163    final class LoaderOfRecord {
1164      private static final Loader<?> INSTANCE;
1165      static {
1166        final Loader<?> rootLoader =
1167          ServiceLoader.load(Loader.class, Loader.class.getClassLoader()).findFirst().orElseThrow();
1168        if (rootLoader.determinism() != Determinism.PRESENT) {
1169          throw new IllegalStateException("rootLoader.determinism() != PRESENT: " + rootLoader.determinism());
1170        } else if (!rootLoader.path().isRoot()) {
1171          throw new IllegalStateException("!rootLoader.path().isRoot(): " + rootLoader.path());
1172        } else if (!rootLoader.absolutePath().isRoot()) {
1173          throw new IllegalStateException("!rootLoader.absolutePath().isRoot(): " + rootLoader.absolutePath());
1174        } else if (rootLoader.parent() != rootLoader) {
1175          throw new IllegalStateException("rootLoader.parent() != rootLoader: " + rootLoader.parent() + "; rootLoader: " + rootLoader);
1176        } else if (rootLoader.get() != rootLoader) {
1177          throw new IllegalStateException("rootLoader.get() != rootLoader: " + rootLoader.get() + "; rootLoader: " + rootLoader);
1178        } else if (!rootLoader.isRoot()) {
1179          throw new IllegalStateException("!rootLoader.isRoot()");
1180        } else if (rootLoader.root() != rootLoader) {
1181          throw new IllegalStateException("rootLoader.root() != rootLoader: " + rootLoader.root() + "; rootLoader: " + rootLoader);
1182        }
1183        INSTANCE = rootLoader.<Loader<?>>load(Path.of(new Token<Loader<?>>() {}.type())).orElse(rootLoader);
1184        if (INSTANCE.determinism() != Determinism.PRESENT) {
1185          throw new IllegalStateException("INSTANCE.determinism() != PRESENT: " + INSTANCE.determinism());
1186        } else if (!INSTANCE.path().isRoot()) {
1187          throw new IllegalStateException("!INSTANCE.path().isRoot(): " + INSTANCE.path());
1188        } else if (!INSTANCE.absolutePath().isRoot()) {
1189          throw new IllegalStateException("!INSTANCE.absolutePath().isRoot(): " + INSTANCE.absolutePath());
1190        } else if (INSTANCE.parent() != rootLoader) {
1191          throw new IllegalStateException("INSTANCE.parent() != rootLoader: " + INSTANCE.parent());
1192        } else if (!(INSTANCE.get() instanceof Loader)) {
1193          throw new IllegalStateException("!(INSTANCE.get() instanceof Loader): " + INSTANCE.get());
1194        }
1195      }
1196    };
1197    return LoaderOfRecord.INSTANCE;
1198  }
1199
1200}
